module.name: wincrt
module.short: Auxiliary windows routines for the graph unit
module.descr: The wincrt unit provides some auxiliary routines for use with the graph unit, namely keyboard support. It has no connection with the crt unit, nor with the Turbo-Pascal for Windows WinCrt unit. As such, it should not be used by end users. Refer to the crt unit instead.

element.name: readkey
element.short: Read a key from the keyboard

descr.p: ReadKey reads a key from the keyboard, and returns the ASCII value of the key, or the scancode of the key in case it is a special key.
The function waits until a key is pressed.

element.name: keypressed
element.short: Check if a key was pressed.
element.descr: KeyPressed returns True if the user pressed a key, or False if not. It does not wait for the user to press a key.

element.name: keypressed.Result
element.short: True if the user pressed a key, false if not.

element.name: delay
element.descr: Delay stops program execution for the indicated number ms of milliseconds.

element.name: sound
element.descr: Sound sounds the PC speaker. It emits a tone with frequency Hz for 500 milliseconds. (the time argument is required by the windows API)

element.name: nosound
element.descr: NoSound does nothing, windows does not support this.

element.name: directvideo
element.descr: On windows, this variable is ignored.

element.name: lastmode
element.descr: Is supposed to contain the last used video mode, but is actually unused.
